messages: a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:44): problem solved.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:44): quite simply, you can't put more than one 2.4 device in a box if its an 802.11g device.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:44): but, you can get away with 1/11 on 11b.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:46): oh well, problem is solved as soon as the 5.8 parabolics show up.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:46): glad you found that out but it should have been obvious
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:47): well it is quite obvious, has been for about 8 months for me.  But now I know why prism/wrap-based operations are getting away with two 11b radios per box.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:47): its like having 2 people shouting at each other
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:47): *technically*
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:47): I am glad you have resolved your problem though
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:48): it shouldn't be a problem... its the crappy filtering ;)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:48): I mean, the entire FM broadcast band in the USA is only 20 mhz wide, and theres 30+ stations in some areas operating at once.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:48): running half a wtfwatt a piece.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:49): the prices we pay for cheap throughput.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:49): are they all in 1 box
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:49): when you're talking about the power levels they're operating at... pretty much :)
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:49): the usa is a fairly big place to spread it around a bit
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:50): well, most cities have tower farms, where the major TV/radio is at.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:50): within a couple miles tuning a cheap FM receiver is a pain.  Everything stomps everything else.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:51): thats called the free market
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:54): its also called trying to cover HUGE areas with one transmitter
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:54): when any 2 radio signals mix together you get the sum and the difference of the 2 signals re transmitted
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:54): the FCC is quite worthless in that respect...  they've let industry bulley them.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:55): it does not surprise me
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:55): most US government agencies are cheap.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:55): I think you are quite right
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:55): you can buy influence from them for a dollah and a dozen donuts.
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:56): its the same across the world
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (02:57): common sense goes out of the preverbial window
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:02): it looks like Jake has no doenuts
4bcb7032ae943478d9515f99d978ec5f (03:02): meh kevin rose made $60M off digg? wtf
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:04): you could soon spend 60m
4bcb7032ae943478d9515f99d978ec5f (03:05): indeed, but its more than digg is worth :)
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:05): you do have a point
4bcb7032ae943478d9515f99d978ec5f (03:05): there must be a crazy amount of money in online ads these days
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:06): only linux users stay poor
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:07): only j/king folks
8cb0105429cf7d667765f31964e3963f (03:07): but then again on reflection
